Efficiency of rrr

Chris Addy

2016-12-08

require(microbenchmark)
## Loading required package: microbenchmark

The rrr package used as a jumping-off point the function rrr1, written by Chuck Miller in 2007 and used in the text. This original function was used to plot rank traces and pairwise plots.

#source("http://astro.temple.edu/~alan/MMST/code/rscripts/RRR+MULTANL.r")

#args(rrr)

## change name of original rrr function so it does not conflict with rrr NAMESPACE

#rrr_original <- function(x, y, k = 0, type = "Identity", rrr.plot = TRUE, missing = "omit", 
#    title = ""){
#       rrr(x, y, k = 0, type = "Identity", rrr.plot = TRUE, missing = "omit", title = "")
#    }
#rm(rrr)

Below are benchmark comparisons of the original rrr function (Miller), with the analogous functions in rrr.

### LOAD DATA

data(tobacco)

tobacco <- as_data_frame(tobacco)

tobacco_x <- tobacco %>%
    select(starts_with("X"))

tobacco_y <- tobacco %>% 
    select(starts_with("Y"))

Rank Trace Plots

#microbenchmark(rrr_original(tobacco_x, tobacco_y))

microbenchmark(rank_trace(tobacco_x, tobacco_y, diag(1, 3)))
## Unit: milliseconds
##                                          expr      min       lq     mean
##  rank_trace(tobacco_x, tobacco_y, diag(1, 3)) 58.78116 72.82337 80.69293
##    median       uq      max neval
##  81.77616 87.71435 111.1119   100

Principal Component Analysis

microbenchmark(pca(tobacco_x))
## Unit: milliseconds
##            expr      min       lq     mean   median      uq      max neval
##  pca(tobacco_x) 1.185893 1.675941 2.031454 2.038327 2.22677 5.067002   100
microbenchmark(prcomp(tobacco_x))
## Unit: microseconds
##               expr     min       lq     mean median      uq      max neval
##  prcomp(tobacco_x) 480.247 608.0775 755.4241 723.36 842.247 2308.671   100

  1. http://astro.temple.edu/~alan/MMST/code/rscripts/RRR+MULTANL.r↩
